catalog_info.title: Public Economics: Designing Government Policy
catalog_info.notes: M., W., (F.), 2:00-3:30, and a weekly section to be arranged. Students should have some knowledge of basic calculus and statistics, but there is no formal mathematics prerequisite. Offered jointly with the Kennedy School as SUP-125. This course offers an optional writing requirement which if completed will satisfy the concentration writing requirement.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Economics 1010a1, 1010a2, or 1011a, or permission of instructor.
catalog_info.description: This course analyzes what role the government should play in a market economy. It covers topics such as tax and welfare policy, unemployment insurance, environmental protection, education policy, social security
